Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend both "The Amazing Spider-Man" and "The Bad Seed".
Both movies are based on popular comics and have gained a lot of popularity among fans.
"The Amazing Spider-Man" is directed by Sam Raiman and stars Andrew Garfield as Peter Parker/Spider-Man, Emma Stone as Gwen Stacy, Jon Favreau as Ben Parker, and Paul Feig as Doc Ock.
The movie follows the life of Peter Parker, a nerdy teenager from New York City who becomes an unlikely superhero known as Spider-Man after being bitten by a genetically altered spider in high school.
The movie also stars Emma Stone as Gwen Stacy, Jon Favreau as Ben Parker, and Paul Feig as Doc Ock.
"The Amazing Spider-Man" was released on May 2, 2012, in the United States, and was distributed by Columbia Pictures.
"The Bad Seed" is directed by Ken Loach and stars Miranda McFadden as Lucy Honeycomb, John Hoxton as Harry Honeycomb, and Lorna Honeycomb as Baby Honeycomb.
The movie follows the life of two children named Lucy Honeycomb and Harry Honeycomb who live in a remote village in Australia with their parents, an elderly couple called George and Ruby, and an adopted child named Sam whose biological mother passed away before Sam was born.
The movie also stars Lorna Honeycomb as Baby Honeycomb.
"The Bad Seed" was released on December 18, 2013, in the United States, and was distributed by Touchstone Pictures.
